channel.title: Statistics on Live Free or Dichotomize
channel.description: Recent content in Statistics on Live Free or Dichotomize

item.title: The Exponential Power Series
item.description: I am a big fan of the Poisson distribution, so much in fact I even have it tatooed on my arm. Finally did it. Guess im stuck with this statistics thing now. #poissonPmf pic.twitter.com/DtTPzOiErd — Nick Strayer (@NicholasStrayer) August 19, 2017 Another thing I am a big fan of the book I am currently reading: Surely You’re Joking, Mr Feynman. In a recent chapter Dr. Feynman discusses his like of the power series expansion of \(e^x\), and how efficient it is.

item.title: Why you maybe shouldn't care about that p-value.
item.description: Setup Recently, there seems to have been an uptick in citations of studies or statistics about this or that in the news and on the internet. As a statistician I think this is great. Anytime we can start to bring objectivity into our assessments of situations it’s fantastic. ⊕This is not to say all data/ stats are objective. Very frequently they can be very dangerously not so. However, I have also noticed some incorrect conclusions being drawn on the basis of these statistics.
